snippet: Heat and drought in the United States, Russia and Europe led to record highs in the prices of corn and soybeans, the United Nations food agency reported.
abstract: United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization reports that global prices for meats, dairy products and cereals resumed rising in September, adding to concerns that developing countries may face food shortages.
lead_paragraph: Heat and drought in the United States, Russia and Europe led to record highs in the prices of corn and soybeans, the United Nations food agency reported.

headline.seo: Global Food Prices on the Rise, U.N. Says
headline.main: Global Food Prices on the Rise, U.N. Says

keywords.value: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
keywords.name: organizations
